value.0: Leave me I have nothing to speak to you on.

We are the Shadow Lords.Your pathetic whimpering will not garner any mercy from us. We are the cullers of the weak. The slayers of the unworthy. Only the best and brightest can claim a place among our number. Are you worthy of such honor, cub?

Good then. We garou are creatures of dominance and submission. We among the Garou tribes, are the ones that most exemplifies hierarchy and order. We are the Shadow Lords. The children of Grandfather Thunder and like him, we rule with a fist of Iron and a voice of silk.

There is plenty more cub. Among the other tribes we are considered manipulative by the other tribes, but a true Shadow Lord is more than just manipulative.Their is an immensely strong tribal unity and individual members forged in the fires of constant competition has bred us into a truly formidable force. Would you like to learn more cub?
What shall I teach you. Our Auspices, Forms, Philosophy, or prehaps our general view on other tribes?
Which tribe?
These inbred fools are our greatest foes. Killing a few of them might do more good than killing a dozen Wyrmspawn. All it takes is one example........
Their Rage consumes them. Our homid and metis are enemies in their eyes. Our lupus, however, find fertile ground here. Most certainly worth looking in to.
They have harnessed the power of the Weaver. They can turn the very things of men into weapons. Be careful, for they are much like us. But we're far mightier, of course.
They are amazing warriors. They are also amazing imbeciles. They are ideal legbreakers. Just make sure they don't figure it out. Not that they will....

Don't underestimate them. They may be drunk, but they still fight with spirit and strength. They are a sizable obstacle to our goals, but their infighting has given us a new opening. Soon they will be our unwitting puppets.
Pacifists. Weaklings. Fools. Could we have asked for better puppets?
Useless rats. They have nothing we want.

We once ruled as powerful warlords in ancient times long past. The tribe has since moved on. Shadow Lords live and die by a certain credo, one of which we do not often speak among other Garou. The credo is simple: werewolves are supreme among Earth's lifeforms, Shadow Lords are supreme among werewolves, and thus it is the Lords' responsibility to rule the rest of Gaia's creatures - for their own good, of course.
Thank you Elder i think i shall go out and start earning my way now.

To a Shadow Lord, hierarchy is everything; the only measure of worth is leadership, and it must be gained at all costs and by any means. For this reason, we strive ceaselessly to dominate human, wolf, and werewolf alike.

First the Homid. As Shadow Lords we are noted for our dignified and regal bearing. Often we are are tall, muscular, and exude a tangible aura of power. We  can be of any racial stock, for the we have bred with the best and brightest of all races.

We are intimidating even in our Homid form, but our Glabro form is truly a sight to dread. The already well-developed muscles of our tribe grow to titanic proportions, claws and fangs grow, and our face becomes a beetle-browed grimace. Shadow Lords in this form have been known to bash down walls, shatter doors, and wade through seas of Fomori to reach a foe.

The fine senses of the Lupus form are unmatched by any other of the Garou shapes. In this shape, a Garou inherits the long distance running abilities of the wolf, and can travel truly amazing distances that way. Garou have been known to run for days in this form without stopping. Shadow Lords in this form resemble huge stocky wolves, bearing the well-known midnight-black fur of the Shadow Lords.

The Hispo form is in many ways reminiscent of the dire wolf of prehistoric times. Though the Crinos form is favored over this one as the ideal form for battle, many Shadow Lords have been known to crush skulls, shatter ribs, and eviscerate foes with a single bite using the huge head and jaws of the Hispo form. This form's senses are more attuned than those of any other form save the Lupus. Human speech is all but impossible in this form. In this form, the Shadow Lords' thick, stocky appearance is obvious and unmistakable.

The Crinos form is not one for persuasion. Heady with power and protected by the Delirium, the Crinos is a terror on the battlefield. The Crinos form of a Shadow Lord is ten feet of furry Rage. The huge muscles of this form make those of the Glabro appear feeble. Claws and fangs are pronounced, and the head becomes that of a snarling canine. In this form, the stocky, black-furred Shadow Lords look somewhat like a cross between a man and a giant pit bull.

First there is the Ragabash. Ragabash born under the waxing moon are said to have a light touch to their comedy. Those born under the waning moon are said to be purveyors of a darker brand of humor. It is said that no Shadow Lord Ragabash are born under the waxing moon, for many of their targets die laughing.

The seer of the Garou, the theurge burns with secret knowledge, and exudes a tangible aura of fear. Even the theurges of other tribes fear the Shadow Lords' seers. Many whisper that the Shadow Lords possess ancient lore lost to other tribes.... things that Gaia never intended for Garou to know

The Philodox keep the Garou at peace with themselves. The Philodox of the Shadow Lords, it would seem, have a near-insurmountable task before them in uniting a tribe that runs on competition and struggle. But such is not the case. Indeed, the work of the Philodox is made easier by this atmosphere, for the ritualized nature of the conflicts allows them to control the very battles themselves. Accordingly, the Philodox of the Shadow Lords are accorded respect, honor, and, above all, power.

The Gilliards are often accused of playing with the minds of other Garou. Of all the Moondancers, those of the Shadow Lords are most adept at such games. Some Garou whisper that they can even enter your mind and control your thoughts. Or maybe that's just what they want you to think......

The warriors of Gaia are renowned for their bloodlust. But simple bloodlust cannot begin to describe the wrath of the Shadow Lord Ahroun. The Ahroun of the Shadow Lords combine the Rage of the full moon with a contempt for the weak. They claim that if their Rage leads them to massed slaughter, all the better, for they have greatly culled the weak from the herd!
No I am not
Yes I am.
Is there anything else sir?
No Elder not today.
Yes I would Elder
Views on other tribes.
Silver Fangs
Red Talons
Warders of Man
Fenrir
Fianna
Children of Gaia
Bone Gnawers
I shall be on my way now Elder thank you
I see. What of the others?
Philosophy
Interesting Creed.
Forms
Then there is... Glabro.
Lupis?
The hispo is what?
Finally the most powerful the crinos.
Thank your your time Elder I will be off.
Auspices
What of the Theurge?
And the Philodox?
And the Gilliard what of them?
Finally the Ahroun
Thank you for your time elder.
Is there more I can learn?
